author: Orian38
title: You are truly wonderful and we are so grateful for all you have done
body:
Unfortunately this story does not have a happy ever after ending as despite all that was done to help Mum after an accident in her home, Mum was unable to recover and passed away in hospital.  
From every member of staff the care Mum and our family received was excellent, the information provided and frequency of communication was ideal; we were kept updated as soon as new information was available or when decisions on care options were available. When Mum became unable to communicate her choices, our views were sought and respected at all times and always without any delay or pressure.  
Mum had arranged many years ago when she was in her 50's for me to be her power of attorney, though in her 80's she remained independent at home and was still very much able to make her own decisions. We had also had the very difficult conversations about what Mum's wishes were if she became ill or was at end of life. If you are reading this and have not yet arranged your power of attorney or even tried to have those hard discussions, please do so as soon as possible - it makes even the hardest of decisions a little more comforting.  
The family members including myself who were with mum at home and in hospital were cared for with so much kindness and sensitivity we agreed that it was important for us to publicly thank the staff.  
The two paramedics from Scottish Ambulance Service kept Mum's spirits up, even though she was distressed and very much in pain. They told her very calmly and clearly what was happening and made mum laugh heartedly in the ambulance despite how scared she was.  
The nurse in the Emergency Department Trauma area was wonderful, as were the medical staff who actively treated mum in the hope she would improve.  
On moving through to the Combined Assessment Area for further treatment, the nurse allocated to care for Mum, who was in Lime Zone Room 11, was attentive, caring and took time to explain everything that was happening to Mum even when she was sleepy, and with his colleagues made sure we were cared for too with offers of food, water, hot drinks and lots of information and reassurance. The medical staff here too were wonderful, it was clear that they were very well briefed from their ED colleagues and consulted us at every stage in Mum's treatment - I really didn't mind telling the circumstances of Mum's accident to each of them as it was clear it was vital for them to assess and treat Mum the best way.  
The next evening Mum deteriorated and while it may be easy to say we all die sometime - for Mum she could only die this once. The lovely care Mum and her family received during her final hours will stay firmly in our hearts for ever. Mum had a lovely death - she had hugs from her Grandchildren, her daughters, daughter in law and son in law - she was comfortable and with her family. Thank you to the staff of Scottish Ambulance Service, the Emergency Department and Combined Assessment Unit at Crosshouse Hospital, you are truly wonderful and we are so grateful for all you have done.

author: sambaks79
title: Felt like my emotions or feelings weren't considered
body:
Last week I was advised to attend the A23 unit at Queens Medical Centre, as I has been up all night with back pain and spotting. I went in and everyone I came into contact with was lovely, and very helpful. During the scan I was measuring at 5 weeks 5 days pregnant (I thought I was 8 weeks based on LMP), they couldn't see a heartbeat, however explained that they would book me in for 2 weeks' time to check again. The ladies doing the scan were really helpful, and answered any questions me and my partner had.  
A couple of days later, I woke up to a gush of blood and went into A&E, where I was transferred to Unit A23 again. After 30 minutes I saw a nurse who was lovely and pleasant and was able to put me at ease whilst asking questions and taking my bloods. The nurse explained that due to my history with my cervix the doctor might want to have a look to make sure everything was OK, but advised that my wait would be a long one as it was the weekend. Me and my partner understood this so agreed to wait.  
After 2 and a half hours, we were called in by a Gyno consult who said very matter-of-factly that this is a case of wait and see, and we should go home and let nature run its course if I'm miscarrying. After 3 hours in hospital, I felt extremely dismissed and fobbed off and with this being my first pregnancy felt like my emotions or feelings weren't considered. I then asked if based on my notes the doctor would like to have an internal look at my cervix, to which they replied that it wouldn't give us any answers and I should just wait for my scan in 2 weeks.  
I now have a week to wait, and I feel as though I don't know what to do. I went home very sure that I'm miscarrying and any hope has gone.  
I just wanted to provide my experience to remind doctors that what they say matters and will stay with someone. Every nurse I have come across has been fantastic, and all conversations over the phone have been really helpful. But the lack of understanding from this Gyno consult felt like a punch in the face after a very hard few days and morning of waiting.

title: Serious overhaul needed
body:
I attend the blood taking service on a regular basis.  There has been no receptionist for years, leaving the phlebotomists to attempt to take blood and man the reception desk.  Today I waited around 15 minutes standing in corridor to be checked in.  About 8 people in queue with me, many with sticks and unable to stand for so long.
In addition the building is in a dreadful state - hardly the setting for a healthcare service.  Open cleaning cupboard next to reception is dreadfully dirty, walls scuffed everywhere.  Please can the head of this service come and look at the state it is in.  The phlebotomists are lovely but I feel for them having to work in this environment.

author: Nano
title: The staff were really wonderful
body: I had day surgery in Wishaw Hospital. The staff were really wonderful. They put me at ease, were so caring and attentive. I could not have asked for better treatment.

title: such a shame
body:
The new system means you wait even longer in a queue to speak to someone who has to take time to complete a questionnaire. 
This then is passed to a doctor to triage. 
I was given a next day appointment as it was deemed that I needed to be seen. 
I couldn't attend the automatic time that was sent to me via text. 
I spent another hour waiting to get back through to reception to explain i couldn't attend that time.
I was advised that we need to ring on the day i could attend instead. Which was that day. 
The receptionist messaged the doctor whilst on phone to explain but didn't get a reply. 
The receptionist rang me back as soon as she did get a reply with the response that they will cancel the next day appointment given, and as its not deemed urgent i am advised to attend the urgent care at Selby and Leeds that same day instead, or else ring the doctor on the same day i was requesting to be seen - which is exactly what i was doing.
There was no option of alternative times to support working people, or an option of a telephone call (presumingly because they still felt i needed to be seen), but worse of all, absolutely no logic to the reasoning.
This is especially when I know from previous experience that if it is not deemed urgent/priority, there will be no appointments for at least 2-3 weeks, certainly not the next day.
In similar contradictory terms, my husbands appointment which was apparently deemed urgent also took 4 weeks to be appointed. 
To add to this, the experience from the minor injuries hospital is that we wait for several hours only to be sent to the hospital or be advised to see a doctor, as it is a nurse led service with limitations. 
The whole service and pathways unfortunately seem like a waste of time for everyone, with inconsistencies and the danger of people waiting longer than they should for treatment. 
It's a shame that the General Practitioner service is getting so far removed from people using them at all and is just going to put a bigger burden on Accident and Emergency services.
I must say, the actual care of all the doctors have been brilliant for our family, but the process of seeing one is really letting the whole service down and I feel sorry for the receptionists that have to deal with the difficulties and contradictory information they have to give.

title: Great practice
body: First port of call was receptionist the young lady could not do enough to answer questions and help with a problem then went to see nurse who was very professional and warm and caring

title: Amazing service from reception team
body:
I don't think I'm able to leave specific names here, so I'll be sending a message to the practice manager to name them as they were both brilliant. 
I called this morning to book a blood test, the amazing receptionist realised that I also needed to book a GP appointment and sorted that out for me, and something else I had forgotten to do. Absolutely brilliant service!
I had put an e-consultation in earlier in the day to sort out an appointment for a completely different problem. About ten minutes after I got off the phone with the receptionist, a second receptionist called me and sorted that appointment out for me straight away. 

I work in a GP practice and I can't tell you all how much I appreciate the amazing service at Grange Park. It's always been a brilliant surgery but the reception team were so efficient and helpful this morning I had to leave a review. I'll be sending a message directly to the practice as I want to name them to the Practice manager. 

Thanks so much again. It's a tough job in general practice and you're doing amazingly!

If this review has gone one twice I apologise, I did it once this morning but I'm not sure if it worked!

title: Can't speak highly enough about this practise
body:
I have been registered here for 40 years.  It started from a good place and has improved steadily over the years.  I can honestly say that I would have been dead 30 years ago without their help.  In my twenties, I had a blood pressure of 190/119 and have required intervention continuously since then.  In the late 90's, I had severe clinical depression and they helped me sympathetically and competently through that.  Now I have type 2 diabetes and they have helped me to stabilize the condition.
There is a team of strong, experienced doctors.  I have consulted with all of them and they have all been effective, sympathetic and highly competent.  The practice has excellent resident nursing staff and they have checked my bp, conducted diabetes checks and taken blood on numerous occasions.  I am quite difficult to take blood from and often leave other clinics with more holes than a pin cushion but the nurses here almost always score a 'hole in one'.  The administrative staff are incredibly organized, sympathetic and helpful.  They are a real credit to the organization.  On occasion, while waiting to see a doctor, I have observed the way they deal with a potentially difficult situation and learned lessons to apply in my own career.
This practice must easily be in the top ten percent of all practices in the United Kingdom.

title: Excellent Care at A&E
body: My husband had an A&E appointment after calling 111. He was given a time slot within the hour, was triaged within 15 minutes of arrival and then had tests within 30 mins. The results were available while we waited and by midday all was done and my husband was vastly reassured. Very efficient service and very kind staff - all of them. Thank you.

title: Online service
body:
I had severe ear pain last night and couldn’t sleep so wasn’t awake between 7 and 9am. Please make one of the online hours later in the day. 
I’m an insomniac and rarely sleep before 3am

title: Brilliant practice
body:
A first class practice, very highly recommended. The doctors and support staff are brilliant, all very professional, caring and you feel in very capable hands. They always do their best for their patients. 
I've been a patient there for 40 years and have no complaints at all.

author: Bo23
title: Their caring demeanour was real
body:
I attended Ulster hospital EOU recently for routine glucose testing. I was there for over three hours.  
I just wanted to make it known that the midwives I came in to contact with were outstanding. I observed as they were so busy dealing with phone calls and panicked mums to be, and it just filled me with such hope that these ladies clearly care. There was no facade on the phone; their caring demeanour was real.  
As I said, my few hours there were routine, I was not a priority by any stretch, yet they didn’t make me feel rushed.  
It was a lovely experience that has filled me with confidence for when I am delivering my baby at the Ulster. A really outstanding team!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sally 123
title: Stay in the surgical ward
body:
Boston Pilgrim Hospital, surgical ward (5A)  
The staff was amazing, caring and there was nothing that was too much trouble for them. Couldn't fault them as a team.  
But on the bad side, the ward was in need of a complete refurbishment and updating as the whole area was so out dated, in my view.  
The main issues was as follows:  
Air Bed/mattress- so uncomfortable and not really easily to move on, not fit for purposes for the patients or nurses, in my opinion. The beds in the ICU unit would be a lot better as these was so much comfortable and gave move stability and a lot more easy to move around on. Plus if all the bed was the same I think it would be more cost efficient and save in the long as all the beds would be the same where at present u have 2 sorts. Being short it took for me to call the nurse every time i need to get out of bed cause there is no function on the patient remove to change the height of the bed, cause with this bed if it's too low the mattress doesn't inflate correct if too low. Which took the nurse away from patient that could need them for an more urgent issue.  
Chairs - being the larger person i could not fit in the chairs on the ward so I couldn't sit out of bed, there this is not good for recovery. The chair also in the icu are perfect and should be used on the ward as these are perfect for the larger person.  
One plug socket per bed - I think this is so out dated when some of the beds need 2 per bed along with all the other pumps and equipment need to be plugged in. Having to use extension lead also can cause issue with trip hazards not only to staff but patients.  
TV/radio monitors - although in place was all out of order so no entertainment was available and there was no access to the hospital WiFi on the ward so I end up having to use my own mobile data and phone to listen to music or watch TV on.  
Over head lights - whilst my stay and patient move the light on the wall and it fell down so they left it, only to be check but a nurse in the morning to find it had nearly fell out of the wall. Spot light in the ceil would be better than stuff having off the walls.  
Call buttons - not all call buttons on the wall was lighting up near the beds so the nurses wasn't sure who need help. To help this would it be an idea to put a red light strip around the curtain rails so they can clearly see that patients need helps faster.

author: Charnap07
title: It was an amazing experience
body: Surgery to repair hernia, staff were amazing, very chirpy and very happy, it was an amazing experience, especially because I was scared and nervous, but after seeing them it was no problem, calm and told everything that was happening

title: Phenomenal service
body: Attended the urgent care and they could not be more helpful, knowledgeable and seen swiftly.  Whilst I had been given the all clear from my injury, the nurse practitioners then called back to let me know something else about my x - ray to be mindful of.

author: Finny
title: The difference it has made is amazing
body: When I was told about intensive interaction I really didn't think much of it to be honest. However since doing this with my son the difference it has made is amazing. I first started it and would only get maybe 5 minutes before he had enough. Now he will interact with me for 30 minutes or more. The eye contact has improved so much from this. He enjoys others company and now requests play with others. Something he never done before. Intensive interaction allowed me to enter his world instead of expecting him to enter mine. He loves it, laughs and smiles the whole time and when he has had enough we stop. All based on his needs which is how it should be. I honestly just wish I had started it sooner.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

title: Good service
body: Doctor was thorough and explained meds in detail and how long to use then for.  Also told me how to order meds for holiday on the system on line app directly to him.

title: Great practice
body: I would like to thank everyone at the practice the care and attention given to my wife just recently has been excellent thank you so much the medical team and reception are excellent . A special thanks to the doctors who my wife has seen .  Many thanks

title: Was given time
body:
A staff member was really helpful in getting  an appointment arranged for me quickly however it wasn't able to be with who I wanted it to be with unless I waited a very long time for an appointment. This meant lack of continuity for me and I felt I needed to start from the beginning with a new doctor I've not seen before. 
I had needed to discuss 2 things and made arrangements for this when I liaised with the member of staff who passed on the appointment request to the booking team but on arrival at this appointment with the doctor I was told only a single appointment had been booked in so I would have to be quick if I needed to discuss both things. This felt a little frustrating and embarrassing.  However the doctor was extremely good and didn't rush me at all or the appointment and gave me all the time that was needed to discuss both things properly.  Thank you Doctor.

title: Well organised practice
body: Booked a blood test online. Attended surgery and had a good relaxing experience. Checked in with reception, awaited notification on large screen in waiting area. Nurse taking blood test put me at easy. All completed with 10 mins of arriving at surgery.

title: Good
body: I didnt to have to wait long for the appointment, I had the procedure explained over the phone and leaflet through post, I was seen and had the procedure done without much delay and the procedure was comfortable.

title: Good practice today
body: Saw nurse practitioner and also nurse for blood test. Both very friendly, good listeners and very professional. Was a pleasure to meet them both.

title: Great Service
body: Called this morning at 8am with a concerning symptom.  Was called back by a GP within an hour and seen 30 mins later.  Examined, reassured and onward referral arranged. Couldn't ask for better care.

title: Great care
body: Having moved to Whitstable in June 2020, we registered with this practice. Since then I have had the upmost care from the doctors and medical team. Their online consultations work very well, which means there is no queueing on the phone for hours. It’s stress free and once it’s done, you can rest assured you will be taken care of. Every member of staff I have met here has been kind, patient, generous with their time and very supportive. I cannot recommend this practice enough.

author: Lone Carer
title: The service has been invaluable
body:
The Angus Overnight Nursing Service serves our community so well.  
As a lone Carer of an older person with multiple disabilities, the service has been invaluable in managing my mother's unexpected health concerns in a timely and effective manner.  
I feel well supported and reassured that I can call on their assistance to take care of my mother's particular health needs during the evening and throughout the night.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

title: Weak Admin.
body:
I live in Bath and have nothing to do with this practice.  Nonetheless, they left a message for someone I don't know on my answering machine! Close to a breach of patient confidentiality, I would have thought! How they managed to confuse a number starting 01962.. with one starting 01225... is a surprise!
As the message sounded urgent, I tried to ring the practice straight away but after negotiating the menu. the sub-menu and the sub-sub menu I was told I was caller number seven in the queue and gave up. I found that they have a "contact us" section on their website so I did.  It took me about 20 minutes to complete the form and I had to be inventive about some of the information as I didn't know who this person was, let alone their date of birth, mobile phone number etc.
The text I got back (so they can't say they never received the contact form) said I'd be contacted in two working days.  These have long passed.  Did I get an acknowledgement?  No.  Did anyone apologise?  No.  Did anyone think of thanking me for the effort?  Apparently not!  
I leave it to the reader to make up their own mind about this.

title: No problems here
body: Thank you all for taking care of my mum last night.  Caring attitude and thorough testing to make sure she was ok to come home this morning.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Patients have priority and feel secure
body: Excellent and responsive service to meet my requirements. Medical review and results feedback was extremely good.

title: Efficient and High Quality Care
body: I have found that using the eConsult service I consistently get an appointment within days, even during busy periods. These appointments have always resulted in satisfactory outcomes and the doctors have been consistently helpful and high-quality. My wife and son also use the practice and have almost always found that it has delivered good outcomes.

title: Great practice
body: Great with the information about exercises  & how to manage pain, also they have a friendly approach.. easy to talk to also

author: CGL Happy Client
title: What an experience it was, it has changed my life
body:
I was a client on CGL's 2 week community detox program and what an experience it was, it has changed my life.  
All staff were superb to work with, I had fantastic support from CC, Neghat, Faz and Alex, as well as being superbly welcomed by every single person who worked there. I also had my key worker Michelle, who is great.  
I was nervous, but the other people like me, the clients, were so nice, we all had a problem with enjoying alcohol excessively. It was a serious problem for all of us and we were here to fix it. We were alcoholics. There, I've said it, it's something that is very hard to admit. It feels shameful, but it's a hugely common problem and we should try to lose our shame and just fix it, yet still I write anonymously.  
We had 2 weeks of informal, relaxed, supportive care from the team members above to help us, including medication to help withdrawal, vitamin injections to help us thrive and acupuncture to help with our anxiety (all optional). But most importantly, we bonded with each of them, as all had great passion and a drive to help us. We also bonded with each other.  
We ended the 2 week program with a wonderful graduation event, where our family and friends were invited to join us to celebrate our achievement.  
Such was our delight with the support we received on the program, each of us in our group (CGL clients), decided we would speak and feedback about one member each of our core team. I was nominated by the other clients to feedback on (CC) and I was delighted to do so on the day and decided I'd share all of this great support from everyone and the feedback I provided on CC here, so that future clients have confidence with the people who are supporting you.  
CC was exceptional - she is authentic, resilient, passionate, innovative and has great charisma, which makes others want to follow her, the key characteristics of a future leader.  
She inspires and encourages, whilst demonstrating empathy. She has a natural knack of connecting positively with others.  
She came up with great ideas such as introducing video clips from us to make our graduation more interactive for the whole audience. She chose songs to kick off the proceedings which really hit at the hearts of all in the room, many of us in tears. They were beautiful choices which told stories of difficult journeys which were so apt for the occasion.  
She pushed out all the stops to help decorate the room and transform a boring office space into a super celebration event. Her desire and drive to make this a fantastic day for all was infectious and certainly paid off.  
But where she really had the opportunity to shine was as the key host/speaker of our graduation event. She is a complete natural, her public speaking skills should be exploited to their full potential and were I a leader of CGL, I would be utilising those skills at every opportunity. She connects with the audience in a way which engages and delights and her great passion as I said is infectious. The crowd loved her.  
Most importantly as a client she inspired and motivated me and that in itself is a quality CGL must embrace, in my view. She is such a credit to CGL, hold on to her and develop her to her full potential.  
Thank you to everyone at CGL. I've had a wonderful experience.  
And most importantly, for others who drink alcohol to excess (you may not feel able to label yourself as an alcoholic), speak to your GP to get a referral, step through their door, feel the care and support and kick this alcohol problem out of your life once and for all.  
Just do it!

author: Mama2208
title: Health visitors appointment
body: We came for a development check with our daughter and saw George, who was absolutely lovely.

title: Great surgery practice
body: I have to visit my surgery several times a year and generally always have a positive experience. Wait times are usually short and each staff member are helpful and polite. The GP’s and nurses give me time to explain and listen and are usually up to speed with my circumstances ahead of the appointment.

title: No available appointments
body: Tried on 9th August to get an appointment.Nothing available until 8th September! Away from 4th -11th September so no good. Receptionist unable to book after 8th as system doesn’t allow it. Waiting room had 1 person there so assume all doctors on a long holiday.

author: echogb49
title: They are amazing people
body:
Appointment at Ayr Hospital to get a melanoma removal from my leg. I had already had the mole removed but was to go back to and get another 1cm all round removed.  
I was nervous coming for my appointment but the staff were amazing, put my mind at ease. I can't fault any of the staff - from receptionist to the nurses that dealt with me, they are lovely, with such a caring manner, to the doctor and theatre staff who kept me calm. They are amazing people.  
A lot find faults with NHS. Well, I say credit where credit is due, thanks again .

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: venusxk94
title: Everyone was so obliging
body:
One day I went shopping and collapsed in the shop. I was taken to hospital and diagnosed with a Stroke.  
After four days in the Victoria I was then transferred to the Letham Ward at Cameron Hospital.  
When I arrived I was confused , upset and down hearted that something could hit me like that.  
As soon as I started my Rehab I didn’t feel as though I was getting out the bit, but I was given the confidence by the Physio team Martina and Chris . Physiotherapy opened my eyes to what could be done regarding your limits  
Occupational Therapy team helping you back to life as near as possible  
Nursing staff backed up everything towards rehabilitation with showering personal care.  
Kelly has been a godsend, keeping us up to date with information we may need when going home, also keeping us entertained with other patients and Activities which kept us sane.  
Everyone was so obliging and I never wanted for anything, it didn’t matter if it was day or night .  
Shirley should be proud of her team .

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I am working in a residential care home. I have always had an excellent experience with all GP's and NP's/ANP's at this Practice Surgery. They are all very professional and are beyond expectations. They have always been very helpful and kind with any queries or medical concerns raised regarding our residents. We always got the appropriate medical support and treatment when needed for our residents, and any referrals needed have been done accordingly to the specialized departments.
All staff (GP's, receptionists, NP's, ANP's) are doing a wonderful job. 
The GP's and NP's/ANP's are doing regular visits for their residents, always ensuring the residents have everything they need for the management of their symptoms and for their comfort. They are very supportive of the palliative care residents and doing also regular reviews. The healthcare professionals at this Surgery are very experienced, and we are very proud to be working with them.
I highly recommend this GP Practice.

title: Appointment systems needs investigation
body: It has been really difficult to book a diabetic appointment so far, I give understanding that with covid , there will probably be a back log of patients and they are probably understaffed but the appointment system in place should be better. My dad was supposed to have a telephone appointment and after 30mins no call, I gave reception a ring first to confirm it is telephone and 2nd that it is normal for this to be happening which reception told me the consultant was only running late. After an hour , I called again then found out it was supposed to be face to face. I have already confirmed with booking team for clarification since the initial letter did say it was face to face but new digital letters and messages sent have been updated to say that it is telephone (have multiple screenshot and messages sent). I have received a confirm message yesterday as well which I confirmed for the telephone consultation to attend as usual and the number that will be called is the correct one. I'm left to leave this review since we have already been messed around so much before, it's either lack of communication and there would be telephone appointments arranged with no notice last year which left with no appointment being conducted because an interpretator was required and my dad have not been seen by the diabetic centre since the time a telephone appointment was arranged without notice till now which is like 1-2 years atleast. Please, if you value your resources,  especially consultant and patient's time,  investigate into faulty systems especially those sent on the nhs portal. This misleading scenarios probably happens to many other patients as well so please , I don't want to whinge but this is the least the center and management should look into to use resources rightfully or else missed appointments will pile up because of a faulty notifying patient system which is the only thing that can improve if staffing, and patient numbers can't be controlled any other way. Thank you

title: Great practice and staff.
body:
I have read some of the negative reviews and am totally baffled, my family and I have experienced nothing but 100% total satisfaction with all aspects of Eden Court. Today I sent a request via email to the surgery requesting an appointment for the flu jab within 30 minutes I had a reply with a date and time. I would really recommend people to use either Systemline or the Eden Court Webb site to request appointments, order medication, ask for a phone call etc etc these systems really work.
In my opinion Eden Court are the best surgery in Birmingham by far.

title: Email
body: I have been trying to contact you by phone and have been on hold for 40 minutes. I need your email to send a doctor's letter. This is a waste of my working day time. It would be helpful for you to provide a clinical email address for professionals.

title: Do something with it!
body:
Rosalind Franklin House is the only place you can register in Waterbeach and is one of few 2-stars GP surgeries on Google Map. 

They have cancelled online booking system in the 21st century and only provide one hour window each morning for making appointments though phone call. Patients queue for ages to get a chance. If you are lucky enough to reach a human being, most time they just arrange the doctor to call you back. When they call you back, they can't even wait 2 minutes for you to pick up the phone.

You should just avoid living in Waterbeach, if you are old or long-term sick people.

title: Lovely GP
body: Recently brought my son to see the GP, i called up and asked for a pre-bookable and was offered one as it was urgent for the day, at time of appointment GP called and discussed my concerns and helped to identify the issue, later saw the GP face to face and he couldn't have been more helpful.

title: Fantastic woman’s health doctor
body: The doctor i had made me feel at such ease while having my treatment. She was very kind and gentle a lovely lady.

title: Experience
body: Friendly and efficient.  Clear explanation as to what I could expect during the procedure that I was to have.  Felt assured, confident and secure.

author: Resilda726
title: I was very lucky to have the greatest and most dedicated team!
body:
I gave birth to my baby boy at Royal Alexandra Hospital Maternity and would like to thank from the bottom of my heart:  
- Gemma, who was there with me from the beginning until the very end of the process. Gemma was very kind and professional and above all very patient with a first time mother to be.  
-Gael, who I cannot thank enough for the strength she gave me throughout the process. Gael, I am almost positive that I would not have made it through natural birth process without your soothing and kind words! Thank you from the bottom of my heart for being such a kind person and such a great professional!  
-Ceara who helped me set up after giving birth. Thank you for being so helpful and kind when i was weak and in need for an extra hand!  
Lastly I would like to thank my midwife, Nicola, who communicated with me and consulted me all the way to giving birth. Megan, who visited me at home, a great professional. And Heather, the health visitor, who is an extremely kind and professional lady.  
Giving birth at Royal Alexandra Maternity was a great experience because I was very lucky to have the greatest and most dedicated team!

author: Soreye
title: Lack of communication
body:
Came to Queen’s Medical Centre recently for a procedure on my eye in the EENT department.  
I arrived at the given time of 12.00p.m. to find around 8 or 10 other people had the same time for their appointments. We were taken in one at a time and I was eventually taken in at about 5.15 p.m. I was the last to be called.  
None of us had any idea why the order was chosen. It didn’t seem to be alphabetical and I was told it was the luck of the draw. Obviously my luck was out, as I was the last.  
I think there should have been more communication beforehand. I didn’t take drink or food or a newspaper or iPad and as I was on my own and was reticent to go down 4 floors to a cafe to buy anything in case my name was called.  
There must be a better system than to have older people waiting around for 5.1/2 hours. Surely it could have been split into several segments to ease the time wait. If this isn’t possible the people should be informed to bring refreshments and a book with them.  
The actual procedure was quick and efficient. Actually it took just 10 minutes after the long wait.  
Regards and many thanks to the staff. It’s the communication and organisation which could be improved.

author: SJC1983
title: Excellent and compassionate care
body:
This is being told retrospectively:  
In January, my daughter jumped off her bed and sprained her finger very badly. We went to A&E at Fife Victoria Hospital and received excellent and compassionate care from James (Nurse Practitioner) and Melvin (A&E doctor). They were both so nice to her and did everything possible to alleviate pain and anxiety. Thank you both.

author: SJC1983
title: Profoundly grateful for the service provided
body:
A sweet got stuck in my daughter's throat recently. She could still breathe but it was lodged firmly and she was in a very bad state.  
A&E at the Vic in Fife prioritised her and saw her quickly. Sandra, the Triage Nurse, did not leave her for a single minute and did everything she could to prioritise her care and make sure she was ok. Luckily it dislodged (thank God) and she received a very thorough follow up from Dr Pitt.  
Dr Pitt and Sandra helped us during what was possibly the scariest thing that's ever happened to me as a mum, and as always we are profoundly grateful for the service provided by the Vic hospital who just carry on being amazing.  
Thank you from all of us

author: JIMBO999
title: Efficient and friendly staff
body:
Admitted to Grantham hospital in early august to have a TKR to my right leg  
This followed several consultations with Mr. Heaton and his team  
This was my first visit to the Grantham hospital and was surprised by how efficient and friendly the staff were.  
Admission to the ward was an easy process and followed admission procedures before being offered either a general anaesthetic or an epidural, I opted for the epidural, not really knowing what to expect as I had never had one before. This was a very strange sensation as apart from numbing all your bottom half of your body use also lose control, as in you cannot move your feet etc  
I was awake throughout the procedure and although I could hear everything going on it did not bother me me in the slightest  
Although painful I was given a cocktail of pain killers which made it bearable  
I cannot recommend the staff and the medical team enough

author: silverwareqt47
title: I cannot fault the care I received
body:
I was booked in for the removal of a Squamous Cell Carcinoma.  
I cannot fault the care I received from the team. Lindsay who looked after me before and after surgery was so kind and helpful.  
The surgical team were excellent and I cannot thank them enough (apart from the injections which, though necessary, really hurt).  
John who took me through to Surgery and surgeons Neil, Frazer and David, as well as the rest of the theatre team.

author: greensc36
title: Nurse made me feel so relaxed
body:
I have a phobia about having an injection, especially if I see the needle. Your nurse, Graham, made me feel so relaxed, we chatted and I did not even know he had injected me.  
I had my daughter with me for support, and she agreed that Graham was excellent in his approach to me. Hope I get Graham if I have to have another injection.

author: Doddie1
title: They are all amazing
body:
From visiting my GP to all the staff in Unit, I have no complaints.  
Each and every one of the nursing team do such a demanding job - they are all amazing.  
The nurses are always friendly and smiling - makes me feel at ease. They go out their way to help and aid their patients. Nothing is too difficult for them.  
They deserve to be treated fairly. Each and everyone of them are stars!  
The speed which diagnosis followed by treatment is incredible (I thought it would take weeks before my treatment began, it was one week!)  
The Macmillan nursing service is also wonderful - so helpful and there to answer and questions or concerns.

author: Shona726
title: Fast, friendly and very helpful. 10/10
body: I have experienced ingrown toenails on my big toes for years. Finally got round to doing something about it. Had treatment privately a few times before self-referring to the podiatry service. I cannot fault the podiatry service in Broughty Ferry. Fast, friendly and very helpful. 10/10.

author: Roundrobin
title: Skilful, efficient and friendly service
body: I really must praise the skilful, efficient and friendly service I have received at the Dental hospital. I went for an assessment and have just had a biopsy in my mouth and I could not have been treated with any more kindness or care. Both my appointments ran to time, everything was explained and the staff are so helpful and efficient. I was anxious and worried and I was put at ease and they did not rush me. Given the pressure the NHS is under I felt this was excellent.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: liberatorzw37
title: Absolutely marvellous!
body:
I cannot fault the service from Dean, he was absolutely marvellous. He spoke to me like I was a human being. I am very nervous about medical appointments and he put me at ease-he really is marvellous and a credit to the profession.  
Dean had a student with him who was fabulous as well and I just cannot fault this service. He also said he’d be looking after me for another year and I thought, Great. I just wanted to say thank you-I can’t praise them enough.

author: sunzy65
title: Dermatology outpatient clinic
body:
What a brilliant team! From the receptionist, to the nurse and the doctor. Everyone was really smiley and welcoming and clear about what was happening and what I needed to do next.  
The premises were comfortable, clean and welcoming.  
All in all a great visit. Thank you!

author: staffmemberfife1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are right on the ball
body:
I was in an accident and the ambulance, came very very quickly. I had to be transferred to the Accident & Emergency Department of the Victoria hospital in Kirkcaldy.  
The Ambulance team were very sympathetic towards me. They were very good with me . They managed to keep me calm throughout the journey and I felt I was in safe hands.  
I spent a little time in the Accident & emergency Department then a short time in the admission's unit. The staff were great in both areas.  
I had a visit to radiology and although I was in a lot of pain I did exactly as they said. They were very good and really understood it was difficult for me as I was experiencing so much pain.  
Since moving into ward 33 the staff here are right on the ball they are all lovely.  
This is a very busy ward but the staff always take time to stop for a chat This is good for me as I don't have many visitors.  
The tea trolley comes around regularly I do look forward to this.  
I have met with the Physiotherapist, she gave good instruction and explanation of exercises that I will be required to do to help in my recovery.  
I also had a visit for the hospital Chaplain, I really did appreciate this.  
To sum up I would just like to say the staff have all been great and the nursing staff here in ward 33 are fantastic.

author: delphinusmm67
title: Such a lovely service
body: After giving birth to my daughter I was referred to the health visitor team at Abbey health Centre, after the lovely care I received from Arbroath Maternity Ward. Jayde was my midwife and the best, she was very nurturing and supportive. My health visitor Anna was unreal too, very nurturing and listened to my concerns , even stayed longer on visits to assure me and my family were supported. Couldn't fault any the health care team, such a lovely service. Thank you.

author: Jamis022
title: The care received was 2nd to none
body: From GP PSA blood test to Urology in PRI to Oncology in PRI. Then Hormone treatment to Ninewells for Radiotherapy ( just finished). The care received was 2nd to none. The staff in radiotherapy were brilliant, starting with Bob on reception, being kept informed at all times in reception of times and making you feel at home. The nurses were all brilliant as well with keeping me at ease while always asking if I had any symptoms and referring me to Specialist nurse when required.

author: Beever66
title: I couldn't have been looked after better
body:
I had shoulder surgery recently, the care I received in Grantham Hospital was brilliant, from start to finish.  
The ward staff looking after me on Surgical Ward 1, I was in side room 2, couldn't have been nicer and their care was excellent.  
You hear so much bad press about the NHS, but honestly I couldn't have been looked after better and I've had a few operations in different hospitals to compare it to.  
Dr Yewlett did the operation which was successful, he is a really nice chap, who explains everything to you and answers any questions without you feeling rushed.  
There are too many staff to name, but a few I can remember are Sonny, Tintu, Nikki, Hannah, Becky, Trish, but you all played a big part in my recovery.  
Thank you

title: Health check
body:
I was grateful to be called for a health check. It was my first ever, that I recall. I’m 68. Earlier this year I initiated a request for a blood test because of my age and absence of health information. It took some persuasion of the surgery but eventually it took place. I was therefore surprised to receive the checkup invitation 7 months later.
The background to the checkup indicated it was primarily about dementia. However dementia was never mentioned during the appointment and when I raised the topic, the link to dementia on the computer did not work. There was clearly a disconnect between the appointment invitation communication details and the actual appointment checklist.

title: Deadfull
body: Total non caring attitude .   No consideration if working and actually want to book ,  told call from 8 am next day fine if not working but can't afford to wait on there convenience and lose wages reception staff rude and unhelpfully.

title: Very helpful
body:
Up visiting very vulnerable relative and wanted to take COVID test before seeing her. Unable to get test from local pharmacy. Polite and friendly receptionist could not find suitable test kit. Phoned upstairs and manager came down with kit for me.
Very very grateful, thankyou

readBy.name: Lancashire and South Cumbria NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body:
Difficult to make an appointment,  much better when there was a drop in system.
But if the symptoms appear to be serious there are out of hours appointments at nearby surgeries.

title: Brillient Staff and Doctors
body:
Rang to book for doctors appointment at 8am 
seen doctor same day and fitted me in for blood test 
saved me lot of time as im working

title: Nurse Blood Test
body:
I had to have a blood test today, the nurse who did the blood test was very kind and explained everything very well 

well done

author: Gemini672
title: Being diagnosed with Crohns disease
body:
I turned 50 and received my bowel screening pack in the post. I returned it and within a week I received the results advising they needed to do further tests. I got a colonoscopy done and was diagnosed with Crohns.  
The first medication didn't work, the IBD team were quick to get it changed and the new medication is working well. They also arranged for me to start B12 injections, as it was low and having an impact on my energy levels.  
THE GGC IBD team have been a great support to me and answered any questions I had. Karen is always at the end of the phone and ensures you don't wait too long for one of the team to get back to you or help if she can.

title: no box in prescription request to add information
body:
The new prescription request sevice does not allow a patient to make special requests for more Medication that has  recently prescribed as there in no longer a box to fill in on line.
There also no way you can contact the practice pharmacy.

author: hydrusrr75
title: Top notch folks
body: Top notch folks from the receptionist to the folks in recovery. Procedure itself went seamlessly and everything was explained wonderfully to me. The kindness of everybody involved really helped calm my nerves.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: BP  test and bloods
body: Extremely grateful for the first class service I have always received from the practice ...follow up by pharmacist was very quick and very informative and a very satisfactory outcome achieved ...

title: Outstanding service
body: Brilliant service, requested a blood test due to concerns with family health - received a response by text within 30min and was able to get my blood tests later that day. Absolutely excellent. Always a lovely team and excellent support.

title: Long delay for an appointment
body:
It is with much regret, that after being with the practice for many years, I have to write a bad report as follows:
On the 2nd August 2023, my wife had a blood test.  A few days later we received a text to say that our GP would like to discuss the results.
A phone call was made to reception, and an appointment was given for the 18th October.  That's 10.5 weeks later.  What is going on Westcourt?  I await your comment.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am sick of the food at this stage
body: I have been in trauma a total of 10 weeks. The nurses are really good. Communication has been fine. The facilities are grand, however, there is no remote and everyone is having to share the same one. If I could change anything about my stay it would be the menus, I am sick of the food at this stage and think there could be a bit more variety. The clock in my room is broke and is still stuck in the month of June.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful Team
body:
My Dad was admitted to Ward 32 on 25/07/2023 and was nursed there until he died on 02/08/2023. My brother and I stayed with him throughout this time.
Words cannot express how we feel about the exceptional care he received. He was so comfortable in his final days and treated with such dignity.
We also were well supported while spending precious time with our Dad. All members of the team were kind, considerate and caring .
Many thanks and gratitude to all

title: Caring practise
body: Helpful reception staff. Doctors take time to listen to you. Clear notices giving information on what the surgery offers to the patients.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Waiting for a scan with no indication on when
body: I came in recently through the ED. The nurses are brilliant. The ward is very clean, I would say it's a lot cleaner than A&E. I would say the communication is good and bad, I have been waiting for 2 days for a heart scan and still haven't been told when I will actually be going. As the last time I went for the scan, there was a blurred part that was unclear. The facilities are good, although one remote for all TVs on the ward is a pain, I have my own tablet though which is grand so I don't worry too much. Bathroom are all fine, everything is accessible to you on the ward. I think the ward needs more staff, there are an awful lot of people laying around waiting for x rays etc. A lot longer than needed.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Difficult to book appointments
body: My complaint is regarding the delay in being able to book an appointment for a Smear test via the telephone system. I received an NHS letter to contact surgery to book an appointment for a cervical smear. I tried to use both NHS ap and patient access ap but there are not any options for this type of appointment. I followed the procedure to call at 8am. The answerphone kicked in and I was no 30 in the queue. I spent 59 minutes listening to the recorded message telling me to be nice to staff, the call will cut off once 60 mins or capacity is reached, Be available for call back and the amount of hours lost if I m not and will have to start again. I found this extremely patronising and stressful, to assume I would be rude and my time is not important. I did get through in the nick of time to be told that there was a long queue for appointments and was put on a waiting list. I did get a call back later in the day and an appointment within the month. I have no complaints whatsoever with call handler and actual appointment. just the telephone system and recorded message.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Needs to be more communication from doctors
body: I came in on the 3d of August, I was admitted through the ED where is spent 9 hours before getting a bed in AMU. The nurses are very good and very helpful. Communication is okay, the nurses try their best but I think there needs to be more communication from doctors. Over the weekend it was difficult as I seen 3 different doctors in 3 days. The facilities are good enough for a hospital. The beds need improved as they're not very comfy at all, also I am just very bored, I think the ward could maybe do something to keep the patients minds busy. I think a TV room would be great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Scared pensioner
title: My trip with my very frightened neighbour
body:
My elderly neighbour is terrified of hospitals, so the visit today is all about her experience.  
On arriving at Pilgrim Hospital a lovely little helper showed us to the Ultrasound department. Here my neighbour was reassured and the scan went without any problems.  
We then went to Ward 1B and saw Sr. Palmer, Fola and Anita who examined my neighbour and helped her through the procedure she had done.  
The staff at this hospital are absolutely amazing and my neighbour and myself cannot praise them enough

author: hillman927
title: My stay was first class
body: My stay in the Rehabilitation ward in Mid Ulster Hospital was first class. The staff were extremely friendly and treated me well. I would definitely return if I need treatment again.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: tigerxc97
title: Made our visit much less stressful
body: Took my daughter for blood test and she is extremely anxious about it due to a previous experience. The lady called Jo who was there was great. She was calm, patient and did not rush us or make us feel silly or as though we were taking up too much time. It made our visit much less stressful so thank you Jo.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: moontt37
title: Made me feel at ease
body: Everything went fine, doctor and nurse made me feel at ease.

title: Excellent care - thank you
body:
I attended the Endoscopy Unit at Basildon on both 1st June 2023 and 5th July 2023.

I was most definitely not looking forward to either procedure that I needed to have, but the kindness, care and professionalism of all staff within the Unit was outstanding.  From the moment I arrived, everyone I met went out of their way to make a not very pleasant experience something much easier to cope with.  How very lucky are we to have people like this working for the NHS?  The hospital should be proud of them and they should be proud of what they do.  From my personal experience of the Unit, the care could not have been bettered, even with private care.  I'd be very grateful if my thanks and comments could be passed on to the staff within the Endoscopy Unit.

author: liberatorqy57
title: Very happy with my experience today!
body:
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
[Very happy with 'Waiting time']  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
Reception staff very helpful, and nursing staff explained procedures well, and I didn't feel the injection at all: very happy with my experience today!

author: Petjf
title: A routine 6 monthly appt
body:
I'm so glad reminders are sent - I'd got it into my head my appt was early September - but for the reminder, I'd have been a no show (something I'd never do intentionally).  
I was seen promptly, had adequate time to discuss what I needed and everyone was friendly (as usual).  
Things do go a bit pear shaped on occasions (this is real life) but not on this occasion. If only every service ran as smoothly?! Thank you.

author: Kate328
title: I was treated with a level of care and compassion which overwhelmed me
body:
I was referred for an urgent colonoscopy due to a concern I may have bowel cancer, as my younger sister died of this two years ago. I was obviously very nervous and emotional about the findings of the procedure.  
From the minute I walked through the doors of the unit, I was treated with a level of care and compassion which overwhelmed me.  
I was looked after by a nurse by the name of Claire and then three ladies in the procedure theatre, led by Michelle. They were brilliant and so friendly and understanding of my feelings.  
Thankfully the outcome was I was given the all clear and I then received wonderful care in recovery ward. I would be grateful if my thanks and deep gratitude could be passed to all staff on duty on that day.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: cyclonebx75
title: Everything about the appointment was super
body:
I took my young daughter to her first speech therapy appointment today with Elaine in John Mitchell Place.  
I feel the need to leave feedback after what was both an extremely positive and pleasant experience.  
Having travelled over 35minutes to attend the appointment, i was running 5-10 minutes late. Elaine greeted us with a smile, told me to relax and not worry at all.  
She was very friendly and put my daughter at ease. It was clear she was used to children and she had a lovely way.  
What impressed me most was the way that Elaine shared her knowledge and expertise with me, to allow me to work with my child at home. She has given me lots of advice and worksheets to complete with my daughter while we wait on her block of therapy. Her strategies are great, and her instructions are easy to follow.  
Everything about the appointment was super.  
As a mother of young children, I've been to many appointments but this was certainly one of the best!! Thank you Elaine!!

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: ANDY2470
title: Health check up
body: The staff were amazing, made me feel at ease, listened and advised, thank you.

title: Blood pressure
body: Went in today to use blood pressure machine, but no ticket came out.  One other person and myself told the receptionist about this,  she said she would take a look, but never came over,  so after about 10 minutes i gave up.  Shoddy service, i was sent a text telling me to come in to use machine,  and this happens.  Surely staff should make sure at start of day, that machine is working, with tickets in it.   Disgruntled of sydenham!

author: Wallu
title: Happy and pleased with the care I have received
body:
I had a lymphoma removed from the middle of my back in hospital about 40 years ago.  
About 30 years ago it grew into a harmless and bloody lump. No one was worried about it until recently it increased in size so that if it snagged on something it could burst. I was referred to the Lawson Clinic for minor surgery.  
As soon as I entered the care treatment room, a friendly GP introduced herself and we discussed how she intended to proceed and how the surgery would be completed. I felt happy to consent and for surgery to commence.  
After a painless local anaesthetic in my back, surgery started. I had no pain and we chatted. I was kept informed by what was happening. Stitches were inserted without pain. I was informed about wound care and dressing and left happy and pleased with the care I had received.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I don’t have any problems
body: I have had a grand stay in Craigavon hospital, the ward is great and all the staff ae so friendly. I don't have any problems, everyone's doing an excellent job, which is all you can ask for. The communication with the staff is good, i don't think there's anything that could be better, you cant complain when your getting great care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Parent07
title: Son had stay after operation
body: My son was in 4 weeks ago for spinal surgery and the staff in Dalhousie were amazing with him, even at difficult times they were so encouraging and also making sure I was ok. Most of the stay it was same staff that were looking after him, which was great as he built up a good relationship with them, especially Erin and student Lexi.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

title: Poor communication and systems
body: I've been trying to get my daughter a medical appointment for 4 weeks now. I've emailed them, used their (rubbish) new system Patches and spent time on hold without success. It's great having a system you can access at all times.  Not great when that system has no appointments available. Not great when you email this and get no response.  Not great when you try to call again and again and have to hang up due to running out of break time without getting through to anyone.  Not great when it is very clear from a system prospective that a child was "granted" and appointment and has still not be able to have one. I've never had this problem with this surgery.  I don't know what has happened but it has not improved the service.

author: Margaret229
title: Excellent care
body:
I just want to praise the staff who take care of my Mother at the Crozier Lodge Day Centre in Banbridge, Co Down.  
She thoroughly enjoys attending and misses it desperately when it is closed for a Public Holiday.  
She is a very social person and enjoys the company and the activities. On the days she attends I know she is occupied and happy and not at home trying to find something to do (which she shouldn't be doing). It gives my Mum great pleasure and gives me peace of mind.  
The staff are all wonderful - as is the bus driver who picks her up and leaves her home. I have nothing but praise for all the staff involved in her care.

title: Helpful
body: I was offered a pharmacist call to assess my prescription medication. After explaining that I had cancelled the two I had been taking, it just seemed like an admin process. There was no queries as to why I had stopped nor follow up process. It would have been helpful to offer / receive feedback from the pharmacist or a doctor. Otherwise I saw little point in the call which I had already confirmed via a form I had completed

author: Anne21
title: Received excellent care
body: Had a knee replacement in Grantham Hospital 2 years ago. From going in to coming out 5 days later everything was perfect, received excellent care by everyone. Food was very good, nice choice, by a friendly lady.

title: Great practise
body: I telephoned the practice to make 2 appointments as I had received a letter to book blood test and cervical test , the receptionist was friendly , professional and helpful ,  I was given 2 appointments on the same day close together which was helpful , on arrival,  there was adequate parking , good clear sign instructions , electronic check in ,  waiting room is spotlessly clean , visually lots of info including TV advertising  , my appointments were on time , the nurses I saw were friendly , welcoming , professional  , made me feel really comfortable  .

author: David281
title: Prompt care and expert treatment
body:
My GP referred me in September 2021 as my PSA was marginally raised.  
Two weeks later an MRI at Queens hospital Romford revealed suspicious areas within the prostate.  
I went on to have prostate biopsy at King George Hospital Redbridge, which confirmed early cancer.  
In October 2021 I underwent robot assisted radical prostatectomy at Westmorland Hospital.  
I was discharged the next day.  
Follow up still continues.  
I am so grateful to all units for their prompt care and expert treatment.

title: Not a great experience
body:
Can't fault the surgeon. He did a fantastic job with my operation.

The issue is with my post-surgery appointment aftercare. They canceled my initial appointment due to strikes, and the second time they canceled without notifying me. As I didn't 'turn up', they discharged me back to my GP. Now I have to go back to my GP to arrange an appointment which is going to delay things.  They really should've called me to let me know what was going on.

title: Bad booking system
body: I was referred at the end of May and booked for an appointment on 11th august. 3 days before the appointment i received a text that my appointment has moved to November 3rd. This was because of overbooking. Now i have to wait an additional 3 months before being seen as all appointments that were still available in september/october and now fully booked

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
